post.author: BNA!
post.body:
Just to clear some things up:

- it is NOT a mod
- it is a project recreate stuff in the Doom3 engine
- it is not a Doom3 vs. XYZengine project
- it is not a gameplay exploration project
- we're doing it just for fun
- everybody is free to participate
- it indeed is a lot of fun to do so

Everybody involved please feel free to add to the list - I'm slowly getting tired of hearing all over it's a non-substantial mod designed to add better gameplay to Doom3...

post.author: zeh
post.body:
From my POV, I'd say it's a tech demo of what the DOOM 3 engine can do that it's not obvious at first glance, and things that have been done on other games/engines (but not on the DOOM 3 game itself) that people want to show you how to do it before you think "DOOM 3 can't do <x> because the game itself didn't have <x> all over" - quite a common mistake these days. In other words, I think it can be seen as a huge sample of techniques - some of them exclusive to the DOOM 3 engine (because of its unified lightning system and other new features) and some of them already well known.

And yeah, it must be pretty fun to do. I wish I had the time to contribute to it...

post.author: Bauul
post.body:
"A traditional gameplay absent tech demo of the lesser known features and previously unexplored potential of the unmodified Doom 3 engine, through a level design absent from the first publicly released product of the Doom 3 engine, Doom 3, as produced for free by members of the Doom 3 community."

How does that sound?
